info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 20 at 1:04PM MDT until June 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
... Critical to Extreme Fire Weather Conditions...
.. Winds will be gusting greater than 50mph with sustained winds between 30 and 35mph. Min RH values will be below 15 percent with minimal overnight recovery into the Mid 20s to low 30s. Rainfall has been below the monthly average suggesting drier fuels.
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 6 PM MDT Saturday.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 421.Fire weather zone 422.Fire weather zone 423.Fire weather zone 425.Fire weather zone 427.
* WIND... Sustained 35 to 45 mph with gusts greater than 55 mph
* HUMIDITY... RH values below 15 percent
* HAINES... 5 to 6
* THUNDERSTORMS... NONE
* * HIGHEST THREAT... Western Carbon County
* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR ELAVATED TO HIGH WINDS AND LOW RH VALUES FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 421, 422, 423, 425, AND 427

area.areaDesc: Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains; Central and West Carbon; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin; North Snowy Range Foothills
